title: RagnarTheThunderer
author: RagnarTheThunderer
content: AI is now managing investments and making trading decisions. Could AI-driven financial systems start buying bitcoin as a safe asset? What happens if AI sees BTC as better than fiat?

comments.author: NotFuzzyWarm
comments.created_time: February 21, 2025, 03:39:05 AMLast edit: February 21, 2025, 04:27:42 AM by NotFuzzyWarm
comments.body: AI is NOT some independent entity that make decisions like that on its own. Folks need to STOP thinking of 'AI' as some kind of self-aware thing that makes decisions about ANYTHING on its own.PEOPLE set the boundaries of what an AI program does and what it is using as references for the decisions it comes up with. It cannot and will not 'just start' buying anything on its own - a person tells an AI trading bot what to trade in be it fiat, crypto, gold, silver, stocks & bonds, etc.Frankly it is no different than any other trading bot other than being able to look at a wider range of inputs to use in the decision making progress. If the bot has been programmed to generate maximum profits by trading among a myriad of things (as defined by a person) and BTC is currently the best bet then yes, it could 'buy on its own' but only because someone has programmed it to do that. Again - no different than any other bot.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: If "AI sees BTC as better than fiat", then it's AI's opinion. Only that, an opinion. AI can't make a decision on behalf of everybody. On its own, it can't create or amend laws, craft policies, and implement them. Can AI buy Bitcoin? Of course, yeah, but provided it's instructed to. Otherwise, AI won't do anything. It doesn't have freewill. It doesn't act on its own volition. It functions according to the instruction of humans. AI is at human beings' disposal. If you set that it will buy Bitcoin if the price touches $95,000, then it will do it provided your wallet has a balance to perform such action. Otherwise, it will fail. Surely, however, AI won't just spend your money buying Bitcoin because it thinks saving in it is better than saving in fiat.

Could AI-driven financial systems start buying bitcoin as a safe asset? What happens if AI sees BTC as better than fiat?The question is not "Could AI do this?". The real question is "When will AI start doing this?". I'm sure that AI trading bots will become a thing in the next months or years. The current AI models are not self-aware right now, but super-AI will become self-aware in the near future.Bitcoin is not a safe asset. Bitcoin is a risky and volatile asset, which can bring higher profits to speculative investors. The AI trading bots could invest in BTC and add it to aggressive and dynamic investment portfolios.I don't think that AI is going to compare BTC to fiat. Bitcoin is a deflationary financial asset, while fiat currencies are inflationary by design.
